column1: CLEVELAND -- The Cleveland Indians waited through nearly four hours of rain to resume their soggy home opener . 	 Their first win is still being delayed . 	 After rallying for three runs in the seventh inning to tie Toronto
column2: the Indians ' bullpen gave up six runs in the eighth and lost 13 - 7 Friday night to the Blue Jays
column3: who overcame their own relief problems and dropped Cleveland to 0 - 4 for the first time since 1985 . 	 Marco Scutaro homered in the fifth and singled home the go - ahead run during Toronto 's outburst in the eighth as the Blue Jays improved to 4 - 1 -- their best start since 2001 . 	 The Indians have given up 42 runs in four games and gotten nothing from their pitching staff . 	 " I do n't think anybody could expect coming out of the gates that we would see what we 've seen so far
column4: " manager Eric Wedge said . " We always talk about being tough on the tough days and this is where they 've got to show that . Everybody needs to have thick skin
column5: they need to be tough and have broad shoulders and fight through this . 	 " It 's a long season . As bad as these four games have been
column7: we 've got to separate from it . " 	 With his bullpen taxed already
column8: Wedge said it 's possible the club will make a roster move on Saturday . 	 Alex Rios and Adam Lind had four RBIs apiece for the Blue Jays . Brandon League ( 1 - 0 ) got the win despite walking a batter to load the bases in the seventh
column9: hitting Ben Francisco with a pitch to force in the tying run and getting his only out on a scorching line drive . 	 League 's shaky outing was quickly forgotten when Lind and Rios drove in two runs each in Toronto 's eighth - inning outburst
column10: which began with Scott Rolen hitting a single off Rafael Perez ( 0 - 1 ) . 	 " I would n't describe it as ugly . I would n't describe it as sloppy . I 'll describe it as a win
column11: " Blue Jays manager Cito Gaston said . " I 'm glad we got it in . " 	 Travis Hafner hit his second homer in two days and drove in three runs
column12: and Victor Martinez and Shin - Soo Choo also homered for Cleveland
column13: the AL 's only winless team . 	 A sellout crowd of 42
column15: which enjoyed the usual pomp and festivities of opening day under a gray sky
column16: was reduced to about 500 for the final out
column18: 12 minutes after Indians rookie starter Scott Lewis threw his first pitch . 	 The Blue Jays
column20: led 7 - 4 in the seventh before the Indians tied it thanks to Toronto 's bullpen self - destructing with four walks and a hit batter . 	 The teams waited out a wet - weather delay that bordered on ridiculous . The dedicated fans who chose to ride it out were forced to endure plunging temperatures and a steady drizzle that never stopped . At one point
column21: the grounds crew removed the tarp and made some minor repairs to the infield before covering it again
column22: drawing moans and boos from the freezing fans . 	 About the only bonus was that the Cleveland Cavaliers ' game at Philadelphia
column24: was put on the giant scoreboard in left field . By the time the game resumed at 9:27 p.m.
column25: the Cavs were in the final minute of a 102 - 92 win over the 76ers . 	 " I thought I was going to be in bed sleeping by now
column26: " Lind said . " We battled through a lot of things and got a nice win . " 	 Rafael Betancourt
column27: who was warming up when the game was halted at 5:40 p.m
column28: finally took the mound in the fifth with the Indians trailing by one . He got through it
column29: but gave up a run in the sixth as Toronto went up 5 - 3 . 	 Choo 's 438 - foot homer to right - center made it 5 - 4
column30: but the Blue Jays tacked on two more in the seventh on Rios ' two - run single . 	 The Indians have been worried about their starting pitching for months
column31: and none of those concerns were diminished when the Rangers held extended batting practice for three days . Cleveland 's top three starters -- Cliff Lee
column32: Fausto Carmona and Carl Pavano -- staggered home with a collective 18.00 ERA and 0 - 3 record . 	 For three innings
column34: holding them to one hit . But in the fourth
column35: Toronto tied it with three runs and four hits
column36: including Lind 's two - run homer . 	 Scutaro
column38: gave the Blue Jays a 4 - 3 lead with his one - out homer in the fifth . Aaron Hill followed with a single and the second baseman had barely touched the bag at first when Wedge bolted from the dugout to rescue Lewis . 	 As Betancourt was making his warmup tosses
column39: the umpires called for the delay not knowing it would last longer than most games . 	 With the Indians already up 2 - 0 in the third
column42: hit a towering homer into the Blue Jays ' bullpen in right . It was a promising sign for Cleveland fans worried that " Pronk " had lost his pop . 	 " Travis is coming around
column43: " Wedge said . " You see him driving the ball and you see him being aggressive . Those are all good things . " 	 Game notes 	  Wedge wishes baseball would consider putting nets along the baselines in all ballparks for safety . " Someone is going to get killed with the broken bats and foul balls
column44: " he said . " It 's an accident waiting to happen . " ... The Indians will skip No . 5 starter Anthony Reyes on Saturday so Lee can face Blue Jays ace Roy Halladay in a matchup of Cy Young Award winners . " Too bad it did n't happen for opening day
column45: " Toronto manager Cito Gaston said . ... As a kid
column46: Wedge had posters of catching greats Johnny Bench
column47: Carlton Fisk and Thurman Munson on his bedroom wall . " My brother had the one of Farrah Fawcett
column48: " he said . ... The delay was the longest in Toronto history . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column49: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column50: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million
column51: sources confirmed to ESPN . 	 From who we think deserves MVP and Cy Young to if the voters got it right
column52: this is your one - stop shop as baseball 's 2021 hardware is handed out .

column1: MILWAUKEE -- Brewers second baseman Rickie Weeks has put on a few pounds since last season
column2: and admits it is n't all muscle . But he still can run -- fast enough to take third base on a wild pitch
column3: then slide home headfirst to complete a thrilling ninth - inning rally . 	 It remains to be seen if Weeks can outrun past criticism of his inconsistent fielding and hitting . But with a new manager comes a clean slate
column4: and Ken Macha liked what he saw in Milwaukee 's home opener
column5: a 4 - 3 victory over the division rival Chicago Cubs on Friday . 	 " What I 've seen from Rickie
column7: " Macha said . " He pretty much won the game today for us . " 	 Weeks made a couple of nice plays in the field early on
column8: then played a critical role in Milwaukee 's rally from a one - run deficit off new Cubs closer Kevin Gregg . 	 Gregg ( 0 - 1 ) walked Chris Duffy with one out and Weeks hit a line drive that sailed over the head of left fielder Alfonso Soriano for an RBI double that tied it at 3 . 	 Weeks then went to third on a wild pitch
column9: and Corey Hart walked to bring up Ryan Braun . He hit a hard grounder to shortstop Ryan Theriot
column10: whose throw home could n't get the sliding Weeks . 	 Cubs backup catcher Koyie Hill
column11: whose sixth - inning homer gave the Cubs the lead
column12: spiked the ball into the ground after the final play and appeared to bark at an umpire -- showing the intensity of a division rivalry
column13: even in April . 	 Cubs manager Lou Piniella would later say that he thought the call was good
column14: and Hill regretted his reaction . 	 " That was the wrong way to act about it
column15: " Hill said . " I was talking to teammates about that . You get caught up in it sometimes . We wished things had gone a little differently . " 	 It could n't have gone much better for Weeks
column16: who hopes experience pays off this season . 	 " The more you grow into the game
column18: " he said . 	 Weeks also has grown physically
column19: putting on at least 15 pounds in the offseason . But he noted that maybe three to five pounds of that is muscle . 	 " So are you saying that 's 12 pounds of fat ? " new Brewers starter Braden Looper playfully jabbed in a postgame news conference . 	 The Cubs appeared to be on their way to victory after Hill hit his go - ahead
column20: two - run homer in the sixth and starter Rich Harden struck out 10 over six innings . But Piniella quickly lost patience as his bullpen issued five walks in the last three innings . 	 " We ca n't walk as many people as we did from the seventh inning on
column21: " Piniella said . " You ca n't do it . You 'll lose . Get the ball over the plate
column22: make the other team beat you . Period . " 	 Carlos Villanueva ( 1 - 0 ) worked a hitless inning for the win . 	 The late rally helped Milwaukee shake off a rough start to the season . The Brewers did n't look much like last year 's NL wild card winners in dropping two of three games at San Francisco . 	 " We get paid to entertain
column23: so we want to make it interesting
column24: " Braun said . 	 After an evening game Thursday
column25: the Brewers arrived back in Milwaukee early Friday morning and faced a quick turnaround for the afternoon start . Hart said he got caught in traffic trying to make his way to Miller Park for the game
column26: throwing off his preparation routine . 	 But Macha did n't want to make too much of the team 's travel hassles . 	 " That 's just part of the game
column27: " he said . 	 Looper was fairly sharp in his first start with the Brewers
column28: giving up one run in five innings despite issuing four walks . Looper
column29: who signed with Milwaukee as a free agent and missed much of spring training because of a tight left oblique muscle
column30: gave up five hits while striking out four . 	 Looper said his side feels fine
column31: but still did n't feel like he had his best stuff . 	 " I just told myself to back off
column32: and almost throw it as soft as I can
column33: " Looper said . 	 Milwaukee took a 2 - 0 lead with an RBI single by Braun in the first inning and a solo homer by Hart in the third . Milton Bradley then led off the fourth with a home run deep onto a walkway in right - center field for his first hit with the Cubs . 	 After retiring the first two batters he faced in the sixth inning
column34: Brewers reliever Seth McClung watched Hill smack a 2 - 1 pitch into the Brewers ' bullpen in left - center . 	 Weeks then helped McClung out of a jam in the seventh
column35: snagging a sharply hit grounder and throwing to first with runners on first and second and two outs . 	 Game notes 	  Piniella said C Geovany Soto was not likely to play in the three - game series because of tendinitis in his right shoulder
column36: but should be available in a few days . ... Macha said injured closer Trevor Hoffman had a throwing session Thursday and was " getting closer " to throwing off a mound . ... Wisconsin native Jeff Skiles
column37: co - pilot of the US Airways flight that successfully ditched in the Hudson River
column38: threw out the first pitch . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column39: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column40: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million

column2: Mo. -- Andy Pettitte beats Kansas City so often
column3: even he has trouble keeping track . 	 The New York Yankees ' left - hander allowed three hits over seven strong innings Friday
column4: striking out six and walking one in a 4 - 1 victory that made him 8 - 0 in his last 12 starts against the Royals . 	 In 16 career decisions against Kansas City
column5: Pettitte is 13 - 3 . That 's more wins against the Royals than any other active pitcher . 	 " To tell you the truth
column7: " said Pettitte ( 1 - 0 ) . " I know they knocked me around pretty good last year in Yankee Stadium . I know I love pitching in this ballpark . " 	 Sidney Ponson ( 0 - 1 )
column8: who made 15 starts for New York last year
column9: gave up four runs and six hits in six innings in his Royals ' debut . 	 A capacity crowd of more than 38
column10: 000 came to see the unveiling of the newly renovated Kauffman Stadium
column11: which underwent a $ 250 million facelift that made it virtually a new ballpark . 	 " They did a great job . It looks wonderful
column13: who was 3 - 0 in four spring starts . " I came out a few hours early and looked around . They did a great job with it . " 	 Brian Bruney pitched a hitless eighth
column14: and Mariano Rivera struck out two around an infield hit for his first save of the year . Fifty - six of Rivera 's 483 saves have come in Pettitte wins . 	 " I thought Ponson did a good job
column16: " Royals manager Trey Hillman said . " There were a couple of different times during the game it looked like he was about to lose it
column17: but he regained it . " 	 Only one ball was hit out of the infield by either team after Mark Teahen 's inning - ending flyout in the sixth . With two outs in the ninth
column18: Teahen got the Royals ' fourth hit on a slow - roller to first . 	 Derek Jeter had an RBI grounder and Nick Swisher doubled home a run for the Yankees . 	 Pettitte walked only one . After issuing a walk in the second inning
column19: he gave up his only run when Mike Jacobs ' fly into shallow right glanced off the glove of Swisher for an RBI double . 	 " I was really upset because I did let the run score
column21: who has six RBIs in the last two games . " I kept telling Andy
column22: ` I 'm going to get it back for you . ' It just seems like every time I come to the plate
column23: [ Robinson ] Cano is standing on first or second base . And the way Mr. Pettitte pitched today was just unbelievable . Tremendous . " 	 New York evened its record at 2 - 2 following a pair of opening losses at Baltimore and a series - finale win at Camden Yards . The Yankees are on a nine - game trip before opening their new ballpark . 	 Festivities marking the reopening of the stadium and the start of the Royals ' 40th season delayed the start for 32 minutes . 	 Jacobs said Pettitte 's breaking ball was particularly effective . 	 " It looked like he was mixing in and out of the strike zone
column24: going in and away on guys
column25: " he said . 	 Ponson got in trouble in the first when Johnny Damon singled
column26: Mark Teixeira walked and Jorge Posada lined a two - run single past Jacobs at first . 	 Swisher doubled in the fourth and scored when Jeter hit into a forceout . 	 After giving up a leadoff double to Teixeira in the fifth
column28: Posada and Swisher around a walk to Cano
column29: all on called third strikes . 	 Kyle Farnsworth was booed during pregame ceremonies after giving up the game - losing
column30: three - run homer to Jim Thome of the Chicago White Sox in Tuesday 's opener . He entered in the seventh and struck out the side . 	 But nobody could stay up with Pettitte . 	 " It means that for four days I 'm going to be fairly in a good mood instead of being miserable and wanting to get back out there
column31: " Pettitte said with a grin . " So for me at this point in my career
column32: that 's what it is . I 'm just happy I could give us a good start . Hopefully we can get rolling and all of us will get going together . " 	 Game notes 	  Ponson 's strikeout of Brett Gardner in the second inning was the 1
column33: 000th of his career . ... There was a moment of silence and flags flew at half - staff for Angels pitcher Nick Adenhart
column34: who died Wednesday night in a traffic accident . ... Outfielder Jose Guillen

column1: DENVER -- Cole Hamels hardly looked like a World Series MVP in his 2009 debut
column2: which resembled batting practice for the Colorado Rockies . 	 After his start was pushed back because of spring training elbow trouble
column3: Hamels was roughed up and chased early Friday in Colorado 's 10 - 3 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies . 	 " I 'm concerned about him
column4: " Phillies manager Charlie Manuel said . " He had a hard time locating pitches . He had a problem with his command
column5: locating the ball where he wanted it . " 	 Jason Marquis pitched seven strong innings in his Rockies debut
column6: and Colorado beat the defending World Series champions in its home opener . The crowd of 49
column7: 427 was the highest paid attendance in a regular - season game at Coors Field
column8: which opened in 1995 . 	 They did n't see the same Hamels who won NLCS and World Series MVP trophies last year . 	 Hamels ( 0 - 1 ) was supposed to start Philadelphia 's season opener Sunday night
column9: but his outing was delayed due to a sore left elbow that slowed him this spring . The left - hander allowed seven runs and 11 hits in 3 2/3 innings
column10: including a five - run third in which gave up half a dozen extra - base hits . 	 " Cole Hamels does n't pitch at 86 mph . He pitches 88
column12: " Manuel said . " That tells me that he 's not quite ready yet . He threw 80 pitches and he got some work in
column13: but at the same time he 's way better than that . " 	 Manuel expects Hamels to throw harder the more work he gets . 	 " Remember
column14: he did n't throw a lot in spring training
column15: " Manuel said . " He still needs work and he 's not real strong at the moment . " 	 Manuel hinted that Hamels might even miss his next start . 	 " We will find out in five days
column16: " Manuel said . " He 's not right . He 's not there . I 'll talk to [ pitching coach Rich ] Dubee and I 'll talk to Cole . " 	 Hamels
column17: who said his velocity is always down this early in the season
column18: said location was his biggest problem
column20: which robbed him of his curveball and forced him to throw a steady diet of changeups
column23: which " were right down the middle . " 	 " I think a lot of it was command
column24: " Hamels said . " I was n't able to locate down in the zone . Most times I was able to get two strikes on a guy but was n't able to put them away . ... Pitchers are n't able to do well when they ca n't hit their spots . " 	 Hamels said he 's always thrown 86 mph in April and hits the 88 - 93 range when the calendar flips to May. 	 " I 'm not an 86 mph pitcher
column25: " he said . " It 's hard to get hitters out throwing 86 right down the middle . You can throw 86
column26: but you have to locate pitches . 	 " Throwing down the middle at 86 is batting practice for most hitters . " 	 Declaring that he 's healthy
column27: Hamels said he wo n't really know if this outing had anything to do with his health until his next start . 	 But will he be on the mound when his turn comes up again at Washington next week ? 	 " It takes hard work the next five days
column28: " Hamels said . " I 'm capable of it . It 's a matter of bearing down and really working . " 	 Marquis ( 1 - 0 )
column29: acquired from the Chicago Cubs in the offseason
column30: looked to be in midseason form . He improved to 4 - 0 at Coors Field by allowing two runs and five hits . He also went 2 - for-3 at the plate with a sacrifice bunt
column31: a run - scoring single and a double . 	 " I try to play the game like I was taught growing up
column32: " Marquis said . " I take pride in whatever I do
column36: pitching . You never know what can help you win a ballgame . " 	 Garrett Atkins homered and Todd Helton drove in three runs for Colorado
column37: off to a 3 - 1 start . 	 Jayson Werth went 4 - for-4 with two doubles and a homer and scored all of Philadelphia 's runs . But cleanup hitter Ryan Howard bounced into three double plays as the Phillies fell to 1 - 3 . They also lost catcher Carlos Ruiz to a strained muscle on his side . 	 Hamels ' unpleasant third inning could have been even worse
column38: but plate umpire Mike Everitt called Dexter Fowler out for runners ' interference when he pushed a bunt up the first - base line and Ruiz picked up the ball and nailed him in the back with a throw to first base . Colorado manager Clint Hurdle argued vehemently and replays showed Fowler never strayed from the chalk line as he sprinted to first . 	 " We did n't agree on anything we talked about out there
column40: the kid 's pushing the ball to the right side . He ran a direct line from as soon as he bunted the ball down to first . I thought the throw snatched Howard into the base path . I do n't see any other way Dexter could run that ball out . " 	 It did n't stop the Rockies
column41: though . 	 Marquis started the rally when he singled home Clint Barmes from second base . After Fowler was called out

column43: his first hit of the season
column44: and Troy Tulowitzki drove in another run with a triple that made it 5 - 1 . 	 Atkins had started out 0 - for-12 before connecting on a 1 - 1 pitch and depositing it high into the left - field bleachers . 	 The Rockies tagged Hamels for four hits and two more runs in the fourth . Ryan Spilborghs hit a two - out RBI double and scored on Helton 's single . 	 " There 's no easy out in our whole lineup
